|brand = D-Link |model = DIR-412 |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = A1 |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = 10/20/2010 |page_start_origon = https://infodepot.fandom.com/wiki/D-Link_DIR-412_vA1 |wlclass = N150 |series = <!-- Device series --> |type = wireless router |sernum = <!-- First 4 or so for easy version identification --> |fcc_id = KA2IR4121 |icid = <!-- Industry Canada Identification number, Leave blank for unknown --> |us_id = <!-- US ID number --> |boardid = <!-- Board Identification, Leave blank for none --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id -->
|cpu1chip1 = Ralink;RT3050;RT3050F; |cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS 24KEc |cpu1_type_rev = <!-- CPU1 type Revision, Leave blank for unknown --> |cpu1spd = 320 <!-- 320 MHz --> |is_doc = |bus = 16-bit
|flash1type = Parallel |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = Macronix;MX29LV320DBTI; |flash1size = 4 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4 --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 32 |ram1chip = Winbond;W9825G6EH-75;W9825G6EH-75 10195 60062P00001; |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |lan_ports = 1 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = F0:7D:68 |oui = F0:7D:68
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = <!-- Name;Version;Distro --> |stockos = <!-- Name;Version;Distro -->
|exp_if_types = USB 2.0 |exp_usb_num = 1 |usb_hub = <!-- USB hub compatibility -->
|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 5 |pwr_amp_dc = 2.5 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = <!-- Outer barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_inner = <!-- Inner barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_len = <!-- Length of barrel --> |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->
|serial = <!-- Full Serial info --> |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = 3G capable |addchip = <!-- Additional Chips --> |802dot11_protocols = bgn
|defaulip = 192.168.0.1 |defaultlogin = admin |defaultpass = <!-- default Password, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultssid = <!-- default Wireless ID, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = <!-- Defaults channel(s) Radio(s) are set to --> |manuf = Alpha Networks |manuf_model = WRG-N28 |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = <!-- Yes, or No, --> |tpfirmware = DD-WRT
|availability = <!-- Market availability --> |eoldate = <!-- End of Life date --> |fccapprovdate = 11/12/2009 |estreldate = <!-- Estimated release date --> |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = <!-- EAN number --> |dx_sku = <!-- DealExtreme sku --> |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = China
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = U.FL |rad1txchains = 1 |rad1rxchains = 1 |rad1sstreams = 1 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 150 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4~2.483
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== OEM Alpha Networks WRG-N28 (8WRGN28..1A1G)
DD-WRT does not have USB support for this model due to the 4MB Flash size. [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=530297]
==Links of Interest== *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?t=78219 On the '''DD-WRT''' Forum]
==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing dd-wrt=== Supported by dd-wrt as of = v.24 SP2 DIR300 Rev B1 - build 12729 - 2009/08/24 dd-wrt
By [http://www.dd-wrt.com/phpBB2/viewtopic.php?p=505465#505465 kings]
# remove power from the DIR-412, then find something to poke the reset hole. # keep pressing the reset inside that hole and give power to the router, keep pressing until the power light turn yellow and start flashing. # connect a lan cable between your pc and router, you need to manually set your pc to 192.168.0.2 # access 192.168.0.1, and you will see an "emergency firmware flashing" page # select the dlink-dir300-factory-webflash.bin and click something like "upgrade" # wait till it finish and you will be able to access the new dd-wrt at 192.168.1.1, also remember to change your pc to 192.168.1.x
but I cannot get the "WAN" port to work as WAN right now, it sort of stuck to lan... WAN interface never get an ip address. I did not try any USB HSPA modem though.
by kojirole
DIR-412 can useÂ D-Link DIR-300(B1)/DIR-600(B1&B2) firmware using Emergency firmware flashing
when using ddwrt,cant use dir-412 as repeater,it will show 2 ssid but you cant repeat anything
enjoy!
==JTAG-Serial Info== ===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== [[File:D-Link DIR-412 rev A1 serial.jpg|Yellow - TX Black - GRN Red - RX|340x340px]]
From left ro right:
1. TX Yellow
2. GND
3. VCC (3.3v)
4. RX (Square soldering pad) Red
Speed 57600
{{/Serial info}}
